Class ChatSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ChatSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ChatSender
extends java.lang.Thread
    Thread class that deals with sending data from the program to a remote host. You may assume that the socket is already connected in the constructor of this class. From there, your thread should wait for input from the main program, and send that input out over the socket. If the socket is closed, the thread should terminate. The thread should also have a method that causes it to terminate, so the main program can kill the thread at any time. $Id: ChatSender.java

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatSender

        public ChatSender(ChatDisplay cd,
                  SocketName n,
                  java.net.Socket sock)
        Constructor. The given Socket is already connected and ready for use.
        Parameters:
        cd - The ChatDisplay object that displays any error messages
        n - The name of the socket this thread goes with
        sock - The socket to send data out to

    • Method Detail

      • send

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Stop waiting for input and terminate this thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        Main thread execution loop. This method should contain a tight loop that calls sleep() and checks the state of the thread to see if it should still be running. The argument to sleep() should be at least 1 second.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
